Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

"There are many strange stories about the raid on the Psynumbra temple. Many men claim they were attacked by the embodiment of despair. I saw something—wisps of shadow that shook with nodding sorrow. I could feel the foreboding terror as they passed through the walls to steal our courage. One of them let out a dreadful shriek and exploded. Inky shadows splattered across my deputies. They clutched their heads and could scarcely string two intelligible words together thereafter. Why would anyone willingly join such a terrible organization?”—Sheriff Mack Willburgh, “RV-44006L: The Psynumbra Death Cult”

“It’s been my observation that, because true lasting happiness requires difficult sacrifices, many societies give up on it altogether. The Psynumbra have clearly decided not only to avoid happiness but to fight against anyone who tries to find it. No matter their race, Psynumbra Initiates stoke hatred and malevolence. Cold and dark, Initiates can rob victims of hope. They employ a psionic attack called a Soul Spear, which breaks the mind of an adversary. I try to avoid them. My friends already think I’m insane as I am.”—Mah Reg’Nib, “RV-22299X: Forlorn Fantasy Destinations”

“The Initiates bound my brother to a black stone slab. They chanted. One lifted a dagger. I gasped. A gloomy ethereal claw reached out from my brother’s chest. It plunged the dagger into his own chest. The Psynumbra followers continued chanting. The shadow claws pulled itself out of my brother’s sacrificed body. Streaks of blood marbled the shadowy Herald of Oblivion. It stared at me. For a moment, I saw my brother’s lost soul tumbling through an endless pit. Panic forced me to flee. They will kill me, but I must warn someone.”—Linda Carpenter, “RV-44002L: The Psynumbra Death Cult”

“The realm of the mind is vast and swirling. With too many senses, a feeling mind is scattered and weak. Those who receive ritual annihilation can only be revived in the single-minded Great Darkness of malice. I tell you this to strip you down. Other sentiments will destroy you. Only then can you wield the Soul Seeking darkness and unlock the Lure of Darkness. Only when you are directed by unadulterated odium will the darkness bind your enemies with cords of despair.” —Murgle Fain, “RV-43092R: Psynumbra Ritual of the Malictor”

“There is something off about this place. The ruins of the Psynumbra headquarters still give me an unsettled feeling. The colony wants a security guard to make sure nobody enters and tries to dig up dirt on the place. Already two intruders were murdered under mysterious circumstances. The last guard quit after a week. But there’s nothing there, right? I want to fight myself just looking at the abandoned building. Sometimes I hear whispers. It’s enough to give a man the shivers.”— Night Watchman, Shaquawn Rhodes, “RV-345699E: Ghost Hunters”
